availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Theron Edmund Hall (Worcester County, Massachusetts, manufacturer and soldier)

body.p: Worcester County, Massachusetts, manufacturer and soldier. Massachusetts native. Son of Edmund Trobridge Hall and Abigail Slocomb Hall. Married to Jemima W. Mann Hall in Holden, Massachusetts, on May 8, 1844. Father of Mary E. Hall, Edmund B. Hall, and Abbie F. Hall. Manufacturer in Worcester County in 1860. Employed Ellen Marsh and Michal Morson as domestic servants in Worcester County in 1860. Served in 21st Massachusetts Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as lieutenant in July 1861. Served in the U.S. Volunteer Quartermaster Department in July 1862, and was later transferred to Camp Nelson, Kentucky, where he was appointed assistant quartermaster and superintendent of the large numbers of African-American refugees who traveled with enlisting African-American soldiers to Camp Nelson.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Massachusetts, Worcester County, Holden, p. 616.
Daughters of the American Revolution, Lineage Book of the Charter Members of the DARVolume 084, p. 307.

Find A Grave, "Theron E. Hall (1821-1880)," Memorial #134225877, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/134225877 (accessed May 31, 2020).
